text_a: US House Republicans eye reluctant Ryan for speaker
text_b: House GOPers are looking into whether they should try to oust Speaker John Boehner (R-Ohio) after he refused to endorse Donald Trump.

text_a: US House Republicans eye reluctant Ryan for speaker
text_b: The House is expected to vote Thursday on the nomination of Rep. Paul Ryan, R-Wis., for speaker.

text_a: US House Republicans eye reluctant Ryan for speaker
text_b: Ryan has been floated as a possible alternative to Boehner, but has been less than enthusiastic.

text_b: Ryan's office says he will not be the speaker.

text_a: US House Republicans eye reluctant Ryan for speaker
text_b: Ryan, a Wisconsin Republican, is seen as a moderate who could help bridge a divide between Trump and congressional conservatives.
